abstract: Op-Ed article by legal scholar Jonathan M Smith asserts police unions' efforts to shield their members from accountability in matters of excessive force have played significant role in diminishing public trust; points to unions' long history of resistance to reforms; says reform is beneficial not only to communities but to officers themselves.
lead_paragraph: Restrictive contracts are shielding officers from proper accountability.

headline.main: Police Unions Must Not Block Reform
headline.print_headline: Police Unions Must Not Block Reform
